content.question: ​Consider the graph of the polar function <math alttext="r equals f open parentheses theta close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, where <math alttext="f open parentheses theta close parentheses equals 4 sin open parentheses 2 theta close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, in the polar coordinate system. On the interval <math alttext="0 less or equal than theta less or equal than 2 pi"><semantics><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, which of the following is true about the graph of <math alttext="r equals f open parentheses theta close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

choices.label: For the input values ​<math alttext="theta equals pi over 4"><semantics><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, <math alttext="theta equals fraction numerator 3 pi over denominator 4 end fraction"><semantics><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>4</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, <math alttext="theta equals fraction numerator 5 pi over denominator 4 end fraction"><semantics><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>4</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, and <math alttext="theta equals fraction numerator 7 pi over denominator 4 end fraction"><semantics><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>7</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>4</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, the function <math alttext="r equals f open parentheses theta close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> has extrema that correspond to points that are farthest from the origin.

For the input values ​<math alttext="theta equals pi over 4"><semantics><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, <math alttext="theta equals fraction numerator 3 pi over denominator 4 end fraction"><semantics><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>4</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, <math alttext="theta equals fraction numerator 5 pi over denominator 4 end fraction"><semantics><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>4</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, and <math alttext="theta equals fraction numerator 7 pi over denominator 4 end fraction"><semantics><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>7</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>4</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, the function <math alttext="r equals f open parentheses theta close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>θ</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> has extrema. However, only the points corresponding to ​​<math alttext="theta equals pi over 4"><semantics><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> and <math alttext="theta equals fraction numerator 5 pi over denominator 4 end fraction"><semantics><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>4</mn></mfrac></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> are farthest from the origin.
